alert.note: Alert for Warren (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 11:59AM EDT until April 20 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Schroon River At Riverbank. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Water reaches minor flood stage with water in nearby lowlands and outbuildings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:46 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:46 AM EDT Wednesday was 7.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 5.9 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Schroon River Riverbank Flood Stage: 7.0 Observed Stage at Wed 11 am: 7.2 Forecast: Wed 2 pm 7.1 Wed 8 pm 7.0 Thu 2 am 6.9 Thu 8 am 6.8 Thu 2 pm 6.7 Thu 8 pm 6.6 Fri 2 am 6.4 Fri 8 am 6.3 Fri 2 pm 6.2 Fri 8 pm 6.1 Sat 2 am 6.0 Sat 8 am 5.9 &&
